title: Horrible App
text: Whoever designed this app shouldn’t be working in technology. You download the app, put in credentials to log in, it then tells you to go to your authentication app (which you’re already in) and input the numbers displayed on your screen…how are you supposed to go to the app if you’re already in the app? And how can you input the numbers on your screen when they’re already there?

title: Great app, needs support for Apple Watch
text: Would love to see better integration with the Apple Watch.  Many times I need to get up to get my phone to type in a number.  Would rather prefer to do this from the watch.

title: Needs Apple Watch App
text: Needs Apple Watch App

title: Don’t force your product

this will never be updated regardless of how perfect the app may be.  Forcing anything is unacceptable

title: Just Allow 3rd Party Authenticator Apps!
text: I don’t need a million different Authenticator apps, just use a standard QR code like most of the industry.

title: Total pain!
text: Just Another Example of Microsoft trying to rule the world.

title: Unable to authenticate sign in on app
text: I am unable to authenticate my email as it is requiring me to type in the 2 digit number in the authenticator app in order to sign in to the authenticator app.

title: Microsoft forced me to download
text: I don’t mind the idea of an authenticator app, but do not make me download it. I would like to be able to sign into my account without having to download a stupid app.

title: Obsolete and unintuitive
text: App is the same name as all other authenticator apps, which either shows hubris or stvpidity, then it doesn’t transfer your data into a new phone, making the whole idea of the 2 factor authentication pointless. On top of that, when recovering the account, it asks for you to authenticate it on the app you’re trying to recover. How obtuse is that? This is a great example of obsolete app development.

title: Bug fix ASAP please
text: Im stuck in a loop where im trying to sign in and it asks me to use the authentication app to authenticate myself… but I am?

title: There should be other options

title: Slow and Annoying
text:
Delays in receiving the notifications or not responding when trying to authenticate. This pops up when the process being worked on has been in use for some time, and comes up each time Templafy comes on, even though Templafy isn’t needed or wanted, like when just reading a document. 

There’s a valid use for Authentication, but it’s becoming increasingly annoying in the application and slow response

title: Literally impossible to authenticate by design
text: Worked fine for a few months, now all of a sudden it will not let me authenticate and keeps telling me to open my Authenticator app and enter a two digit code. So, I’m already IN THE APP and the app is telling me to open THE SAME APP to enter the code it’s giving me!! Spent hours trying to figure this out and everything leads back to this same screen with no apparent way to get past it. Literally makes no sense at all.

title: This App
text:
Is utterly useless. It creates more problems then it can actually solve. It’s a huge inconvenience and does NOTHING to make anything better or more secure. It locks you out on a continuous loop of needing to get a code from the app you’re ALREADY ON. STAY AWAY FROM THIS APP

Only giving 1 star because I can’t give it 0

title: Can’t access my account
text: The app requires an authentication code to login. It tells me to “enter the code sent to the Authenticator app” that I’m already on?? If I can’t access my account how am I supposed to get the code to log in?? I’ve tried different browsers and it still doesn’t work. I don’t have a “try another option” button which would be great. I’ve searched the support features and they’re absolutely useless for this scenario. I’m just trying to get my work done and this makes it so much more stressful than it needs to be.

title: Redundant

title: Don’t bother logging in if you don’t have your phone
text: I have to use this app because of my schools mandate of it and it’s very poor. It says you can have it not ask for a code for 45days… that’s a lie. My school strictly uses this app for every single login I would need… As the title suggests say I'm not at home and don’t have service or if my phone died we’ll say goodbye to being able to do absolutely anything. It’s mandatory that you have your phone for this and it’s awful I do 90% of my work on my computer or iPad and I can’t login to anything on them if my phone isn’t present.

title: Its an app
text: I find this app to be bizarrely redundant and generally more of a nuisance than a help; I have to enter my phone’s pass ode multiple times to just unlock the app before having to go through Another code process to actually use it and it’s just Another step to complete something very simple, check my email, that it personally doesn’t add any value to. But I have to use it for work and otherwise would never use it so I imagine folks who opt in would have a different experience of it.

title: More steps

title: Authentication?
text: Need help! Can’t authenticate my company email in Outlook. Outlook says open the authentication app and enter the number shown but when I open the app there’s a number already in the app. I have tried on Windows, MacOS, and IOS, it’s always the same. Am I doing something wrong or is it a bug or a known issue. Please help.
